jgame

Interface Context


  • public interface Context
    The context for a controller or listener on a given object.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getGameBounds()
      Gets the game boundary rectangle.
      <T extends GPaintable>
      java.util.List<T>      		 getInstancesOfClass(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      Gets all instances of the given class currently present in the game.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getKeyCodesPressed()
      Gets the key codes for keys currently pressed.
      java.awt.Point getMouseAbsolute()
      Gets the mouse's position relative to the main game.
      int getMouseButtonMask()
      Gets the mouse button mask.
      java.awt.Point getMouseRelative()
      Gets the mouse's position relative to the top-left corner of object's parent.
      <T extends GObject>
      java.util.List<T>      		 hitTestClass(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      Tests whether the given object is touching any members of the given class or subclasses thereof.
      boolean isMouseInScreen()
      Determines whether the mouse is currently in the game screen.
      void setCurrentGameView(java.lang.Object viewName)
      Sets the game view to the given view.
      void stopGame()
      Stops the game at the end of the frame.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameBounds

        java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getGameBounds()
        Gets the game boundary rectangle.
        Returns:
        the rectangle

      • getInstancesOfClass

        <T extends GPaintable> java.util.List<T> getInstancesOfClass(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Gets all instances of the given class currently present in the game.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for which to gather instances
        Returns:
        a list of all the instances

      • getKeyCodesPressed

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getKeyCodesPressed()
        Gets the key codes for keys currently pressed. The array contents should be the contents defined in KeyEvent.
        Returns:
        the key codes

      • getMouseAbsolute

        java.awt.Point getMouseAbsolute()
        Gets the mouse's position relative to the main game.
        Returns:
        the mouse's position

      • getMouseButtonMask

        int getMouseButtonMask()
        Gets the mouse button mask. Use the constants defined in MouseEvent to extract the individual buttons.
        Returns:
        the mouse button pressed

      • getMouseRelative

        java.awt.Point getMouseRelative()
        Gets the mouse's position relative to the top-left corner of object's parent.
        Returns:
        the mouse's position

      • hitTestClass

        <T extends GObject> java.util.List<T> hitTestClass(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Tests whether the given object is touching any members of the given class or subclasses thereof.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to test
        Returns:
        a non-null but possibly empty collection containing each object o in the current game for which o.hitTest(t) and clazz.isInstance(o) both evaluate to true, where t is the object for which this ListenerContext was created, and excluding t from the list

      • isMouseInScreen

        boolean isMouseInScreen()
        Determines whether the mouse is currently in the game screen. If it is not, the values of the four mouse functions should be ignored as they are not reliable.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is in the game screen, or false if it is not

      • setCurrentGameView

        void setCurrentGameView(java.lang.Object viewName)
        Sets the game view to the given view.
        Parameters:
        viewName - the name of the view to set
        See Also:
        GRootContainer.setCurrentView(Object)

      • stopGame

        void stopGame()
        Stops the game at the end of the frame.
